result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel S. Lucka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payable at the rate of $50.00 per month, starting on or before January 15, 2016 and on the same  day thereafter each month, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.
Added to payment plan.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State. Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Poss.  Defendant plead no contest to count 1.  Joint recommendation for $50, plus costs.  Dismiss but read in Count 2.  Court advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties he is pleading to.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered her plea and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of count 1.    Count 2 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Joint recommendation for $50 fine, plus costs. Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered $50.00 fine, plus CC.  DNA submission and surcharge.  Pay @ $50/mo starting 1/15.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

No appearance by defendant.  SPD William Poss appeared in person.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.   SPD Poss states he expected his client to be here.  Court notes that there was not a notice of hearing sent on this case.  Rescheduled plea/sent to 12-14-15 at 10:30.

Pre-trial conference at 10-14-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 11-02-2015 03:00 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared through his Attorney, William Poss.  Defendant had court in another county this AM.  Attorney Poss will file an authorization.  Reading of the complaint waived.  Defendant stood mute to the charge.  NGP entered.  Track citation.  PTC & STC dates set.  Bond continued.
Defendant called at 8:14 stating he also has court in Monroe County this morning.  He thinks he qualifies for a SPD so I gave him the number and told him to call them right away.
